about.title: About Fertilizers
about.subtitle: Understanding the essential nutrients your soil needs for a bountiful harvest.
about.importance_desc: Fertilizers are essential for modern agriculture, providing the necessary nutrients often deficient in soil. Proper fertilization can increase crop yields by 40-60%.
about.n_desc: Vital for plant growth and development.
about.p_desc: Crucial for energy transfer and root health.
about.k_desc: Enhances water regulation and disease resistance.
about.organic_desc: Natural sources for long-term soil health.
about.ph_desc: Maintaining the right acidity for nutrient uptake.
before_points: Conduct soil testing to determine nutrient levels
env_points: Use buffer zones near sensitive areas
about.urea_desc: High nitrogen content, essential for green leafy growth.
about.dap_desc: Rich in phosphorus and nitrogen, crucial for root development.
about.mop_desc: Provides potassium, helping plants resist diseases and drought.
about.npk_desc: Balanced blends of Nitrogen, Phosphorus, and Potassium.
about.nitrogen_role: Nitrogen (N): Promotes lush, green growth and protein production.
about.phosphorus_role: Phosphorus (P): Essential for root growth and flower/fruit development.
about.potassium_role: Potassium (K): Regulates water use and improves plant resilience.
about.tip_timing: Timing: Apply fertilizers at the right growth stage for maximum absorption.
about.tip_quantity: Quantity: Avoid over-fertilization, which can damage soil and environment.
about.tip_moisture: Moisture: Ensure proper soil moisture for nutrients to dissolve and reach roots.
